column2: The owner of a Georgia gun range, his wife, and their 19-year-old grandson were murdered on Friday at the facility in what appears to be a robbery. Grantville Police reported that 40 weapons and a security camera recorder were taken from Lock, Stock and Barrel—which is about an hour southwest of Atlanta. Cops say the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms was called in to investigate because of the number of weapons that were stolen. The range was owned by 71-year-old Thomas Richard Hawk Sr. His grandson, Luke, was home from college on a break and was helping out his grandparents, 11 Alive reported. The triple homicide was discovered when Luke’s father went to the range Friday night after no one came home. Read more at The Daily Beast.
